docs.snippet: SEA ISLAND, Ga., Jan. 15 (AP) -- Patty Berg took the lead in the first round of the thirty-six-hole Sea Island women's open golf tournament today with a par 37, 39 -- 76, but she plans to go back to her old putter tomorrow.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEA ISLAND, Ga., Jan. 15 (AP) -- Patty Berg took the lead in the first round of the thirty-six-hole Sea Island women's open golf tournament today with a par 37, 39 -- 76, but she plans to go back to her old putter tomorrow.

headline.main: Miss Berg Takes First-Round Lead in Sea Island Open Golf Event With 76; FORT MYERS STAR ENJOYS SHOT EDGE

docs.snippet: SEA ISLAND, Ga., Jan. 16 (AP) -- Mrs. Jackie Pung of Honolulu I registered a four-stroke victory in the Sea Island women's open golf tournament today, scoring a 73 for a 151 total.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEA ISLAND, Ga., Jan. 16 (AP) -- Mrs. Jackie Pung of Honolulu I registered a four-stroke victory in the Sea Island women's open golf tournament today, scoring a 73 for a 151 total.

headline.main: Mrs. Pung Victor by 4 Strokes With 73 for 151 at Sea Island; Miss Rawls Gains Second in Open Golf Event -- Patty Berg Returns an 83

docs.snippet: Yesterday's early morning decision of the Council of the Organization of American States to provide arms for Costa Rica was historic in the literal sense of the word. It is the first time the mechanism of the Rio de Janeiro Pact (the hemispheric...
docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday's early morning decision of the Council of the Organization of American States to provide arms for Costa Rica was historic in the literal sense of the word. It is the first time the mechanism of the Rio de Janeiro Pact (the hemispheric equivalent of NATO) has been invoked to seek military assistance against aggression.

keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

docs.snippet: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, Jan. 16 -- Rebel airplanes continue in control of the air in the Costa Rican combat zones to the north of this capital, the investigating commission for the Organization of American States said here late this afternoon.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, Jan. 16 -- Rebel airplanes continue in control of the air in the Costa Rican combat zones to the north of this capital, the investigating commission for the Organization of American States said here late this afternoon.

headline.main: Rebels Still Control the Air In Costa Rican War Region; REBELS RULE AIR IN THE WAR ZONE

byline.original: By PAUL P. KENNEDYSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, Jan. 20 -- Nicaragua and Costa Rica have accepted an Organization of American States' plan to establish land and air buffer zones along the northwestern Costa Rican border.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, Jan. 20 -- Nicaragua and Costa Rica have accepted an Organization of American States' plan to establish land and air buffer zones along the northwestern Costa Rican border.
docs.abstract: Quintanilla repts Nicaragua and CR accept OAS plan for land and air buffer zones along CR's NW border; map; Figueres see fighting over in few days; repts on La Cruz action; Nicaragua to patrol own border and guarantees to disarm and intern rebels crossing it; OAS forces to patrol buffer zones; com repts F-51 pilots deny crossing Nicaraguan border; Mex sends 2 planes to join patrol group; Uruguay to send planes

docs.snippet: TAMPA, Fla., Jan. 20 (AP) -- Mickey Wright of San Diego took a two-stroke lead after eighteen holes of the Tampa Women's Open Golf Tournament with a 74.

headline.main: MISS WRIGHT'S 74 PACES LINKS FIELD; San Diego Golfer Leads by 2 Strokes in Tampa Event -- Four in Group at 76

docs.snippet: PANAMA, Jan. 22 -- The friction between Costa Rica and Nicaragua has focused attention on the question of quarrels in the American family of nations and the means of settling them. Reason seems slowly to be replacing bloodshed.
docs.lead_paragraph: PANAMA, Jan. 22 -- The friction between Costa Rica and Nicaragua has focused attention on the question of quarrels in the American family of nations and the means of settling them. Reason seems slowly to be replacing bloodshed.
docs.abstract: OAS action in CR-Nicaragua conflict revd as showing procedures orgn uses in settling disputes

headline.main: CENTERS OF DISCORD ARE WIDESPREAD IN LATIN AMERICA

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Jan. 26 -- From the working man's point of view, 1954 was "probably the best of the post-war years," David Morse, director general of the International Labor Office, said in a statement published here today.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Jan. 26 -- From the working man's point of view, 1954 was "probably the best of the post-war years," David Morse, director general of the International Labor Office, said in a statement published here today.
docs.abstract: ILO Dir Gen Morse repts '54 best yr since '45 for workers; revs data

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 27 -- The Soviet Union again put on record today its routine protest against Nationalist China's presence in a United Nations body.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 27 -- The Soviet Union again put on record today its routine protest against Nationalist China's presence in a United Nations body.
